content: this elephant lovey crochet pattern is perfect as a new born baby gift or to sell at market stalls this is an intermediate crochet pattern using worsted weight yarn all details are below however as a quick summary on the difficulty rating this elephant lovey crochet pattern does require color changing crocheting in the round lemon peel stitch and bobble stitches in short if you can color change comfortable and follow instructions even beginners could pick up this pattern and start crocheting the pattern is available for free on my blog 1 but if you d prefer the ad-free version as a pdf download this can be purchased from my ravelry store materials needed ---------------- * **yarn ** aran/worsted weight yarn i used rico design creative cotton aran in the following colours grey 80 grams = 136 m / 149 yds white 45 grams = 76 5 m / 84 yds pink white 45 grams = 76 5 m / 84 yds * **crochet hook ** size 4mm g & 5mm h * **other materials ** stuffing needle scissors pins stitch marker black embroidery thread optional safety eyes 8mm optional - not suitable if item is made for a child under 3 monkey lovey size ----------------- using the yarn and hooks specified in this pattern my elsie turned out to be 32 cm / 12 6″ high from the top of the elephant s ears to the bottom of the blanket and 52 cm / 20 5 wide from corner to opposite corner across the blanket gauge ----- gauge is not required for this pattern however keep gauge consistent throughout for reference my gauge was as follows **amigurumi pieces ** 5 single_crochet stitches on 2 5 cm/ 1 5 row on 2 5 cm / 1 **blanket ** 6 double_crochet stitches on 5 cm/ 1 3 row on 5 cm / 2 5 additional information ---------------------- * **pattern language ** english * **pattern terms ** us terms * **stitches used ** magic_ring single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch flo blo bobble lemon peel st alternating single_crochet & double_crochet increases and decreases * **yarn ** the yarn choice is completely up to you and you can change the yarn weight material and colours based on your own personal preference just be aware that the weight of your yarn may impact the hook size you need to use and also the size of your final make * **hook size ** i recommend using a smaller hook size than recommended on the yarn label for the amigurumi pieces this will stop the stuffing from appearing through your stitches you will also need to change crochet hook size for the blanket * **eyes ** in this pattern you have the choice of using safety eyes or embroidered eyes instructions are included for both please note that safety eyes are a choking hazard and are not suitable for children under 3 years of age * **working in rounds ** all parts within this pattern are worked in
